channel.title: Euro 2012 Football daily
channel.description: James Richardson, Barry Glendenning, Rafa Honigstein, Sid Lowe and the rest of the Guardian's Football Weekly team deliver a daily dose of puns and punditry as they round-up all the action from Euro 2012
channel.itunes:author: guardian.co.uk
channel.itunes:summary: James Richardson, Barry Glendenning, Rafa Honigstein, Sid Lowe and the rest of the Guardian's Football Weekly team deliver a daily dose of puns and punditry as they round-up all the action from Euro 2012

item.title: Euro 2012 Football Daily live - video preview
item.description:
James Richardson and guests Philippe Auclair, Raphael Honigstein and Michael Cox of Zonal Marking discuss the forthcoming tournament before a live audience
James Richardson
Raphael Honigstein
Ben Green
Michael Cox
item.itunes:author: guardian.co.uk
item.itunes:subtitle: James Richardson and guests Philippe Auclair, Raphael Honigstein and Michael Cox of Zonal Marking discuss the forthcoming tournament before a live audience
item.itunes:summary: James Richardson and guests Philippe Auclair, Raphael Honigstein and Michael Cox of Zonal Marking discuss the forthcoming tournament before a live audience

item.title: Euro 2012 Football Daily: the big preview
item.description:
Podcast: In a special live show brought to you by Guardian Extra, AC Jimbo and co look ahead to Euro 2012. Can Spain successfully defend their title - or will it be Germany, Holland or even England that triumphs in Poland and Ukraine?
James Richardson
Ben Green
Michael Cox
Raphael Honigstein
Sid Lowe
item.itunes:author: guardian.co.uk
item.itunes:keywords: Euro 2012, Euro 2012 Group A, Euro 2012 Group B, Euro 2012 Group C, Euro 2012 Group D, Sport
item.itunes:subtitle: Podcast: In a special live show brought to you by Guardian Extra, AC Jimbo and co look ahead to Euro 2012. Can Spain successfully defend their title - or will it be Germany, Holland or even England that triumphs in Poland and Ukraine?
item.itunes:summary: Podcast: In a special live show brought to you by Guardian Extra, AC Jimbo and co look ahead to Euro 2012. Can Spain successfully defend their title - or will it be Germany, Holland or even England that triumphs in Poland and Ukraine?

item.title: Football Weekly Supplement: Chelsea champions of Europe

Amy Lawrence
